sub_title: President at Dutch Australian Cultural Centre
summary:
A highly experienced energy industry vice president / senior manager with more than 35 years of global experience in the industry with Shell, Mubadala Petroleum and Staatsolie Maatschappij Suriname. Happily retired and not looking for work in this field anymore, 
Currently doing voluntary tasks as follows:
- President of the Dutch Australian Cultural Centre (DACC). The DACC is a Sydney based organisation, established in 1983, which has as its aims and objectives the collection, preservation, promotion and dissemination of Dutch culture and heritage in Australia.
- Voluntary guide at the Australian National Maritime Museum in Sydney, being guide on the heritage ships moored at the museum's jetty's. In addition being sailing crew on the replica of the 16th century Dutch VOC tall ship the "Duyfken". 
- Utrecht University alumni ambassador in Australia.

Lived and worked in 11 different countries. A strong passion for travelling, team work, project execution, technical excellence and Dutch heritage.

profile_positions.description: The Dutch Australian Cultural Centre has as its aims and objectives the collection, preservation, promotion and dissemination of Dutch culture and heritage in Australia. It was established in 1983 as a company limited by guarantee to preserve the rich history of Dutch contact with and immigration to Australia.
profile_positions.title: President

profile_positions.description: Advising independent oil and gas companies on Exploration and New Ventures. Assisting independent investing companies on investment strategies in the oil and gas industry.
profile_positions.title: Vice President Exploration - Exploration / New Venture Manager

profile_positions.description: Managed the exploration asset teams, application management team and petrophysics/well site geology team. Turned around an exploration department, which had suffered from lack of leadership and no prospect portfolio in licenses held for many years, into a high energy, focused environment with emphasis on technical excellence and play-based exploration workflows. In a short period of time delivered a high quality prospect portfolio in the five large Exploration licenses in the Gulf of Thailand, with special emphasis on near existing infrastructure exploration and greenfield new hub exploration. Drilled two important, successful play openers. As a member of the management team strongly involved in the day to day running of the Thailand business unit. Special emphasis on exploration support and data integration with the development teams. Also championed HSSE and CSR initiatives.
profile_positions.title: Vice President Exploration

profile_positions.description:
Managed the execution of an aggressive (today already proven successful) near field exploration campaign in the Taranaki Basin, the execution of a greenfield exploration campaign in the Great South Basin (GSB) south-east of the South Island and identified and landed new opportunities under a growth strategy, which was successful with the addition of a very large prospecting license in the New Caledonia Basin and additional acreage in the GSB. A very strong drive on technical excellence in the execution of the projects and virtually managed the evaluation effort of three technical teams spread over different locations (Netherlands, Malaysia and New Zealand). Was heavily involved in very successful mitigation of Non Technical Risk with stakeholder engagements, ranging from government organizations, NGO’s, industry, indigenous people organizations, fisheries, industry, councils etc. 
As Exploration Manager I was a member of the Country Leadership Team and as such involved in the running of the business for Shell New Zealand and the operating company STOS.
profile_positions.title: New Zealand Exploration Venture Manager

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for exploration execution and growth of Shell’s Single String Ventures in the Asia region (Philippines, Brunei SDB and New Zealand) and assist in the evaluation of new ventures in the region (Malaysia, Indonesia, Vietnam, PNG). The team was directly involved in the identification to execution process of a large number of evaluations, managed the drilling of exploration wells in Brunei (Maharadja Lela fields) and the Philippines and worked up the New Zealand prospect portfolio. 
The New Zealand portfolio grew as a result of the evaluations and farm-in activities to a level that the set-up of an exploration office in country became essential and I was selected from a global pool to lead it as Exploration Manager.
profile_positions.title: Manager Exploration Single String Ventures – Execution and Growth, Asia

profile_positions.description: Lead a team and had responsibility for the regional geology knowledge of SE Asia in the company. Deputy Exploration Manager SE Asia. Large number of farm-in evaluation, datarooms and commercial negotiations and a major Yet-to-Find study. Set up CI, attended national scout meetings and build a system to capture competitor activity and strategy. Member of the Geoscience Education Board of the Universiti Malaya and instrumental in mentoring of MSc students and provide industry experience to undergrad geology students.
profile_positions.title: Principal Regional Geologist

profile_positions.company: Shell Exploration and Prod. Ukraine I B.V.
profile_positions.description:
After initiating and leading the evaluation of the prospectivity of Ukraine and building relationships and negotiating potential deals in country from scratch, started the formal country entry of Shell into the country. Built up the organization, developed strategy, workplan, venture plan etc. Continued negotiating agreements in a very difficult, ever changing political environment. After JAA (Joint Activity Agreement, 50% NOC, 50% Shell) was ratified (June 2006) started with formal JAA meetings as JAA Technical Director / deputy GM. Evaluation of JAA acreage (data purchase, preparing for seismic acquisition/drilling etc), supervised regional evaluation (PBE) and opportunity evaluation and identification. Worked very closely with midstream and downstream who followed exploration and also started to set up business in Ukraine. Assisted in relationship building, (field-)audits etc. 
Note that I received the gold award of the Academy of Science of Ukraine for the most influential geoscientist of the year 2005 and the Medal of Merit Grade I from the Association of Ukrainian Geologists (associated with AAPG) in 2007. Very strong focus on HSSE, CSR, NTR and especially business principles.
Due to change in political landscape and the related stalling of progress, this time looking long lasting, I was transferred to Malaysia and was only replaced 1 1/2 year later
profile_positions.title: Technical Director JAA / Exploration Manager Ukraine

profile_positions.location: Assen and The Hague, The Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Managed a large team to identify, assess, define and land new exploration business opportunities in greater Europe (Greenland to Russian border). Large number of opportunities screened and worked in widely varying depositional and political environments in Greenland, Iceland, Portugal, Spain, France, Switzerland, Montenegro, Bulgaria, Rumania, Latvia, Hungary, Ukraine, Italy etc. The Dniepr Donets Basin in Ukraine was identified (following a Central and Eastern Europe wide screening study) as an outstanding opportunity. I initiated the venture from scratch by going there and started relationship building and negotiating potential deals. Not deterred by the Orange Revolution and regular changes in political leadership I was directly leading the commercial negotiations with government organisations and the NOC, leading a multi-disciplinary team. Formal country entry was started in Q1 2006. On the back of the exploration entry Gas trading, downstream and Shell Global Solutions followed, leading to a fully integrated value chain into Ukraine. Opportunities that my team developed in Greenland and Italy were later added to the Shell portfolio. 
I was fully involved in Global NV strategy development and execution as member of the Global New Venture team and in Europe wide Exploration as member of the Europe Exploration Leadership Team.
I was selected to follow the executive leadership programme “Leader of the Future”.
profile_positions.title: Regional Manager Exploration New Business Europe

profile_positions.description:
Identification of remaining prospectivity in a highly mature area. Innovative techniques were used to identify new opportunities by tapping into corporate knowledge. A large number of projects were taken from the identification to the execution stage, including a large corporate acquisition, farm-ins, near field and regional evaluations and big punts on new plays. The team was recommended for its 80/20 approach, knowing when to stop and high quality output.
Due to its success the responsibilities of the team gradually grew to cover the countries bordering the North Sea and Eastern Europe.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator/teamleader Exploration New Opportunities Team
